mdRecord.dcterms:title: Mrs. Washington's Room where she died.
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Dillon, Luke C., 1836-1904
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Cabinet card of Mansion's south lumber room, once believed to have been occupied by Mrs. Washington upon George Washington's death and formally titled 'Mrs. Washington's Bed Room or Chamber.' Later determined that Mrs. Washington resided in a different chamber on the third floor of the Mansion. The following text is printed directly onto the reverse of the cardboard mount (upside down): Mrs. Washington's Room where she died. Copyrighted by Luke C. Dillon, Photographer to Mount Vernon, Office at Pullman's Photo Supply House, 935 Pa. Ave. Washington D. C.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: p Mansion interior
p South Lumber Room
